item.title: High prevalence of anaemia among pregnant women in North Karnataka, Raichur worst hit
item.description:
<![CDATA[
Bengaluru: Alarmingly high levels of anaemia continue to afflict pregnant women in Karnataka, with northern districts faring the worst, Karnataka Anaemia Status Report 2024-25 shows. The report highlights stark disparities between regions, raising concerns over maternal and neonatal health.Statewide, 74% of newly registered pregnant women were found to have haemoglobin (Hb) levels below 11 g/dl, classifying them as anaemic. Districts such as Raichur (91%), Dharwad (90%), and Koppal (89%), wh...]]>
